title: Augusta County: Cyrus Alexander to John H. McCue, December 18, 1858
summary: Cyrus Alexander tells John H. McCue of his financial woes and updates McCue on friends and family, including the engagement of their sister, Elizabeth, to a Colonel Bell, as well as offering comment on McCue's estrangement with his father. Alexander also asks McCue if he knows of a "cheap hand" to work at the house.
keywords: African Americans, Death/Casualties, Economy, Family, Home Front, Slavery, Women, American Civil War
